Issues.Title: fix: handle invalid UTF-8 in Ruby and Vue preprocessors
Issues.Body:
## Summary

This PR fixes a panic that occurs when the Ruby or Vue preprocessors encounter files with invalid UTF-8 bytes.

**The issue:**
- `ruby.rs:37` and `vue.rs:18` used `std::str::from_utf8(content).unwrap()` 
- This panics when processing files containing invalid UTF-8 bytes

**Error message:**
```
thread panicked at crates/oxide/src/extractor/pre_processors/ruby.rs:37:59:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Utf8Error { valid_up_to: 45, error_len: Some(1) }
```

**The fix:**
- Wrap UTF-8 conversion in `if let Ok(...)` to gracefully handle invalid UTF-8
- Skip regex-based template extraction when UTF-8 conversion fails
- Allow byte-level processing to continue (in Ruby's case)

This can happen in Rails projects when:
- Binary files are inadvertently scanned
- Files contain non-UTF-8 encodings  
- Files are truncated at multi-byte character boundaries during parallel processing

## Test plan

- [x] Added `test_invalid_utf8_does_not_panic` test for Ruby preprocessor
- [x] Added `test_valid_utf8_with_multibyte_chars` test for Ruby preprocessor
- [x] Added `test_invalid_utf8_does_not_panic` test for Vue preprocessor
- [x] All existing tests pass (`cargo test pre_processors` - 43 tests)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix: handle invalid UTF-8 in Ruby and Vue preprocessors" (#19588)

Issues.Title: Functional utilites: Can't use `--value()` in media/container query
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v4.1.18

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js App directory - Webpack

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v25.0.0

**What browser are you using?**

 Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/FKD8ntInhO

**Describe your issue**

I was migrating a plugin form v3 to v4. I found the new functional utility system to be amazing and cover all the needed cases to migrate it. 

The only issue I ran into was using `--value()` inside the query part of a @media or @container query; the value function is included verbatim in the build instead of inlining the value.
CSS mandates that it must be static so I can't just save it in a variable first.

--------
### Original JavaScript plugin

This plugin keeps a solo child centered inside a container, resizing the child to fit the container; while maintaining a fixed aspect ratio. It utilizes the `aspect-ratio` container query.

```js
const plugin = require('tailwindcss/plugin')

module.exports = plugin(({ matchUtilities }) => {
    matchUtilities({
        'aspect-container': value => [
            {
                display: 'flex',
                justifyContent: 'center',
                alignItems: 'center',
                width: '100%',
                height: '100%',
                maxWidth: '100%',
                maxHeight: '100%',
                container: 'aspect / size'
            },
            {
                '> *': {
                    aspectRatio: value,
                    width: '100%',
                    height: 'auto',
                    maxHeight: '100%'
                }
            },
            {
                [`@container aspect (aspect-ratio > ${value})`]: {
                    '> *': {
                        width: 'auto',
                        maxWidth: '100%',
                        height: '100%'
                    }
                }
            }
        ]
    }, {
        values: {
            '8.5x11': '8.5/11',
            '8.5x14': '8.5/14',
            '11x17': '11/17',
            'A3': '8.27/11.69',
            'A4': '8.27/11.69',
        }
    })
})
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Functional utilites: Can't use `--value()` in media/container query" (#19580)

Issues.Title: chore: Update outdated GitHub Actions versions
Issues.Body:
## Summary  
This PR updates outdated GitHub Action versions by migrating `actions/download-artifact` from `v6` to `v7` in the following workflows:  
- `.github/workflows/prepare-release.yml`  
- `.github/workflows/release.yml`  
- `.github/workflows/release-insiders.yml`  

## Test plan  
The changes will be tested in the CI pipeline of the pull request.

Issues.Title: Utility classes are not generated when using escaped special characters in theme variable names
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v4.1.18 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Vite 6.2.6 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v24.4.1 **What browser are you using?** Chrome, Safari **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/MhIIQSyw5e?file=css **Describe your issue** Hello and thanks for the wonderful library. Tailwind v4 is really nice to use. I have a color pallete that we used in v3 which looks like: ```js '@elevation-base': 'var(--color-gray-50)', '@fg-pro-base': 'var(--color-purple-500)', ``` In the process of migration to v4, I converted it to: ```css @theme inline { --color-\@elevation-base: var(--color-gray-50); --color-\@fg-pro-base: var(--color-purple-500); } ``` But it doesn't seem to work properly when I try to use it like this: While IntelliSense is working great, utility class is not generated.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Utility classes are not generated when using escaped special characters in theme variable names" (#19569)

Issues.Title: Custom breakpoint values get applied in the wrong order
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

4.1.18

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

vite 7.1.12, @tailwindcss/vite 4.1.18

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

24.11.0

**What browser are you using?**

chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macos

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/qqHR8bOY2n

Initially its using default breakpoints. If you then uncomment the custom breakpoints, the media queries dont override each other in the right order.

**Describe your issue**

When using custom breakpoint values, they get applied in a wrong order. In the tailwind play link, the query element should change color as the container gets narrower. 

red > orange > yellow > green > blue...

However, when you uncomment the custom breakpoints, this behavior breaks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom breakpoint values get applied in the wrong order" (#19567)

Issues.Title: Angular 21 cannot automatically recover using @apply with Tailwind CSS 4
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/issues/17295

This hasn't been fixed. `Angular 21.0.8` and `Tailwind CSS 4.1.18`.

Try setting invalid class value inside `css file` using `@apply inset-shadow-md;`:

```
Error: Cannot apply unknown utility class `inset-shadow-md`
    at onInvalidCandidate (/Users/milan/Sites/tailwind-shader/node_modules/tailwindcss/dist/lib.js:21:1511)
    at Te (/Users/milan/Sites/tailwind-shader/node_modules/tailwindcss/dist/lib.js:16:36652)
    at /Users/milan/Sites/tailwind-shader/node_modules/tailwindcss/dist/lib.js:21:355
    at Rr (/Users/milan/Sites/tailwind-shader/node_modules/tailwindcss/dist/lib.js:3:1718)
    at _ (/Users/milan/Sites/tailwind-shader/node_modules/tailwindcss/dist/lib.js:3:1377)
    at $e (/Users/milan/Sites/tailwind-shader/node_modules/tailwindcss/dist/lib.js:21:172)
    at un (/Users/milan/Sites/tailwind-shader/node_modules/tailwindcss/dist/lib.js:38:294)
    at async cn (/Users/milan/Sites/tailwind-shader/node_modules/tailwindcss/dist/lib.js:38:631)
    at async Xr (/Users/milan/Sites/tailwind-shader/node_modules/@tailwindcss/node/dist/index.js:10:3417)
    at async I (/Users/milan/Sites/tailwind-shader/node_modules/@tailwindcss/postcss/dist/index.js:10:3977)
Application bundle generation failed. [0.046 seconds] - 2026-01-16T08:56:24.924Z

‚úò [ERROR] Cannot apply unknown utility class `inset-shadow-md` [plugin angular-css]
```

Correcting error and setting class to a valid value, like `@apply inset-shadow-sm;`, application cannot recover until restart.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular 21 cannot automatically recover using @apply with Tailwind CSS 4" (#19566)

Issues.Title: üö® [security] Update h3 1.15.4 ‚Üí 1.15.5 (patch)
Issues.Body:
üö® Your current dependencies have known security vulnerabilities üö® This dependency update fixes known security vulnerabilities. Please see the details below and assess their impact carefully. We recommend to merge and deploy this as soon as possible!
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è h3 (1.15.4 ‚Üí 1.15.5) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/h3js/h3) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/h3js/h3/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Security Advisories üö®

üö® h3 v1 has Request Smuggling (TE.TE) issue

I was digging into h3 v1 (specifically v1.15.4) and found a critical HTTP Request Smuggling vulnerability.

Basically, readRawBody is doing a strict case-sensitive check for the Transfer-Encoding header. It explicitly looks for "chunked", but per the RFC, this header should be case-insensitive.

The Bug: If I send a request with Transfer-Encoding: ChuNked (mixed case), h3 misses it. Since it doesn't see "chunked" and there's no Content-Length, it assumes the body is empty and processes the request immediately.

This leaves the actual body sitting on the socket, which triggers a classic TE.TE Desync (Request Smuggling) if the app is running behind a Layer 4 proxy or anything that doesn't normalize headers (like AWS NLB or Node proxies).

Vulnerable Code (src/utils/body.ts):

if (
    !Number.parseInt(event.node.req.headers["content-length"] || "") &&
    !String(event.node.req.headers["transfer-encoding"] ?? "")
      .split(",")
      .map((e) => e.trim())
      .filter(Boolean)
      .includes("chunked") // <--- This is the issue. "ChuNkEd" returns false here.
  ) {
    return Promise.resolve(undefined);
  }

I verified this locally:

  • Sent a Transfer-Encoding: ChunKed request without a closing 0 chunk.
  • Express hangs (correctly waiting for data).
  • h3 responds immediately (vulnerable, thinks body is length 0).

Impact: Since H3/Nuxt/Nitro is often used in containerized setups behind TCP load balancers, an attacker can use this to smuggle requests past WAFs or desynchronize the socket to poison other users' connections.

Fix: Just need to normalize the header value before checking: .map((e) => e.trim().toLowerCase())

Release Notes

1.15.5

compare changes

Important

Security: Fixed a bug in readBody(event) and readRawBody(event) utils where certain Transfer-Encoding header formats could cause the request body to be ignored.

In some deployments (for example, behind TCP load balancers or non-normalizing proxies), this could allow request smuggling. The handling is now safe and fully compliant. (read more)

ü©π Fixes

  • readRawBody: Fix case-sensitive Transfer-Encoding check causing request smuggling risk (618ccf4)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 11 commits:

  • chore(release): v1.15.5
  • chore: fix more ts/lint issues
  • chore: update deps
  • chore: fix ts issue
  • fix(readRawBody): fix case-sensitive `Transfer-Encoding` check causing request smuggling risk
  • ci: fix publish tag
  • chore: update publish tag to 1.x
  • chore: update ci
  • chore: add `test:types` script
  • chore: update ci
  • chore: update deps

Issues.Title: Footer copyright year not updated to 2026
Issues.Body:
Description:
The website footer displays a hardcoded copyright year, which requires
manual updates and can become outdated.
For Version -4.1



Steps to Reproduce:
1. Visit the Tailwind CSS website
2. Scroll to the footer
3. Observe the copyright year

Expected Behavior:
The footer should automatically reflect the current year.

Actual Behavior:
The year appears to be hardcoded.

Additional Information:
Using a dynamic value like new Date().getFullYear() would prevent this issue
from recurring in the future.

Contributor Note:
I‚Äôd be happy to submit a PR to fix this if that‚Äôs okay.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a211994c-2a49-4731-8d34-e87757daf489)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Footer copyright year not updated to 2026" (#19560)

Issues.Title: Carbon Components Svelte Not Working With TailwindCSS v4
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v4.1.17

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** @tailwindcss/vite v4.1.17, Svelte 5.45.6, Vite 7.2.6

**What version of Node.js are you using?** v20.19.4

**What browser are you using?** Edge, Chrome

**What operating system are you using?** Windows

**Reproduction URL** https://github.com/[SLAN14/Test](https://github.com/SLAN14/Test)

Until TailwindCSS v3, carbon components svelte was seamlessly working with tailwind. But after I migrate to v4, the same code is not compatible anymore and either of the CSS are lost with every permutations.

The piece of code with issue:
```
	import './layout.css';
	import "carbon-components-svelte/css/white.css";
```

Post debugging a bit, I could finally narrow down the problem. The issue is when I apply the carbon styles, tailwind's directives are wiped out and to have persistent tailwind styles, I need to force important flag on tailwind config (which is not ideal).

A solution over here would be helpful. Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Carbon Components Svelte Not Working With TailwindCSS v4" (#19559)

Issues.Title: Upgrade tool (3 -> 4) migrates `maxWidth` configuration to `container` vars
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** For example: v4.1.18 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Vite ^7 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v22.21.1 **What browser are you using?** Firefox Nightly **What operating system are you using?** MacOS **Reproduction URL** If you use custom `maxWidth` values in your Tailwind v3 config and then migrate to Tailwind 4, those values are moved to the `--container` vars which then affect built-in classes like `columns-3`. I made a reproduction repository: 1. Commit with Tailwind v3: https://github.com/infomiho/tailwind-upgrade-container-repro/commit/385433c9df278e8bcd7af05e0d3af867b857e3f6 3. Commit with Tailwind v4 after running the upgrade tool: https://github.com/infomiho/tailwind-upgrade-container-repro/commit/9f1ef85663358849f07adf537e44b67ec787a6bf **Describe your issue** I'd expect `columns-3` not to be broken after an upgrade :) Not sure what's the way to pull this off.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Upgrade tool (3 -> 4) migrates `maxWidth` configuration to `container` vars" (#19555)

Issues.Title: I want to donate for under $120, and I don't expect anything in return
Issues.Body: I heard about the business situation. As someone who uses tailwind, I'd like to donate, not for more features, just to support you all. However, it seems that the only donation you all will take is $120/year. As a broke student, I don't have that, but I'm sure myself and many others would donate to help keep tailwind afloat. I'm sorry if this is the wrong place to put this, please tell me and I'll close this issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "I want to donate for under $120, and I don't expect anything in return" (#19544)

Issues.Title: Responsive variants not generated when using prefix in Tailwind CSS v4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Responsive variants not generated when using prefix in Tailwind CSS v4" (#19543)

Issues.Title: display: none !important; #19538
Issues.Body:
Bug  #19538 

This change keeps existing behavior intact while reducing selector impact by moving the :where() wrapper to the full selector.

It does not remove !important or change semantics, but improves composability for component libraries and advanced overrides
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "display: none !important; #19538" (#19539)

Issues.Title: display: none !important;
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v4.1.18

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js 13.5.11

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v24.11.1

**What browser are you using?**

Brave, but it is chromium

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://tailwindcss.com/docs/preflight#elements-with-a-hidden-attribute-stay-hidden

**Describe your issue**
```
[hidden]:where(:not([hidden="until-found"])) {
  display: none !important; 
}
```
it is bad css. I worked before for version tailwindcss@3 but now it property broken my css. 
`!important` It's more difficult to raise the style priority in this case, and the shared style library shouldn't use it, I think. I can create a MR to fix this behavior, unless there's a compelling reason to keep it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "display: none !important;" (#19538)

Issues.Title: preflight.css contain styles that aren't applying together
Issues.Body:
Hi there! I noticed that the following file contains styles that aren't applying together:

https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/79711678fac74f61aae17b25ce51b5f6c409bb31/packages/tailwindcss/preflight.css#L209-L219

`vertical-align: middle` is not working with `display: block`.

MDN [says](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Reference/Properties/vertical-align):

> Note that vertical-align only applies to inline, inline-block and table-cell elements: you can't use it to vertically align [block-level elements](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Block-level_content).

Should I create a PR to fix it?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "preflight.css contain styles that aren't applying together" (#19540)

Issues.Title: Add funding info to package.json
Issues.Body: Just noticed funding property in `package.json` files had not been set, perhaps by choice, but just in case. ## Summary Adding funding information to package.json files, such that users of Tailwind CSS might become aware of sponsor opportunities. ## Test plan NA. Will give funding info upon package installation and running `npm fund`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add funding info to package.json" (#19534)

Issues.Title: `@import 'tailwindcss/utilities' important;` generates invalid custom properties
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`@import 'tailwindcss/utilities' important;` generates invalid custom properties" (#19531)
